Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma smashed eight sixes and seven fours, clearing the boundary over cover and mid-wicket with a mixture of brilliant timing and sheer power.
Rohit Sharma set the fastest ever against Australia, passing the 50-run mark in 19 balls.
Travis Head's 76 kept Australia in the game before they finished 7-181 in reply.
Mitchell Starc (2-45), Pat Cummins (0-48), Adam Zampa (0-41), and Marcus Stoinis (2-56) all went at more than 10 an over.
David Warner was dismissed for six in the first over of the chase.
Glenn Maxwell and Travis Head were together in the middle, providing hope for Australia.
Jasprit Bumrah removed Travis Head with a brilliant slower ball, ending Australia's hopes.
Pre-Game Insights: Australia's World Cup hopes in Afghanistan's hands after loss
Rohit Sharma's dominant performance was expected to be key for India
India's team score was 1-52 when Rohit passed the 50-run mark
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma feeling good after exacting some revenge on Australia for last year's World Cup final.
Australian captain Mitch Marsh spoke on what he called a 'disappointing' loss for his side.
India's captain Rohit Sharma was named the Player of the Match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain delays led to the game being postponed until the next day.
